intro: Pleroma velutinum, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Pleroma velutinum is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
